definition: derogatory sense/negative connotation
to diminish/to demote/to reduce or devaluate/to disparage/to censure/to depreciate
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: In the context of ethnic tourism, commercialization often has a pejorative connotation.
sentences.chinese: 在民族旅遊語境中，商品化經常帶有貶義色彩。

sentences.english: I agree I am ambitious, and I don't see that as a pejorative term.
sentences.chinese: 我承認我有野心，但我不認爲這是個貶義詞。

sentences.english: The term scholasticism then began to be used in a derogatory sense.
sentences.chinese: 任期士林，然後開始用在一個帶有貶義色彩的意識。

sentences.english: Now, this is considered a derogatory term, "Kou Men" has become cool themselves.
sentences.chinese: 如今，這個被認爲貶義詞的“摳門”卻變得酷起來。

sentences.english: Greentech Stops being a dirty word.
sentences.chinese: 綠色技術不再是帶貶義的字眼。

sentences.english: Derogatory term for a gay Iowan.
sentences.chinese: 愛荷華同性戀者的貶義稱呼。

sentences.english: A farm worker tasked with picking and packing corn.
sentences.chinese: 玉米包裝工是愛荷華同性戀者的貶義稱呼。

sentences.english: Yuppie, depending upon who uses the term, is viewed as either a positive or a negative term.
sentences.chinese: 雅皮一詞被視爲褒義還是貶義，取決於其使用者是誰。

sentences.english: The word has a pejorative overtone.
"Corn packer is a derogatory term for a gay Iowan.
sentences.chinese: “玉米包裝工就是愛荷華同性戀者的貶義稱呼。”

sentences.english: But the play fast and loose is a derogatory term.
sentences.chinese: 但反覆無常應該是一個貶義詞。

definition: ambiguity/several possible meanings
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
to quote out of context (idiom)
Zen saying repeated as cant/(fig.) catchphrase/mantra/favorite expression/stock phrase
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
usage (of a term)/wording/phrasing
faulty wording/mispronunciation due to a speech defect
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
horrid
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
written language
a lie/untrue statement/misstatement
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
to show off/to make a display of
layman
malicious
